emuInput.TitMainTitle: Hazel Garland interviewing Mrs. Ellis Blockson, president of the City-County Federation of Negro Women's Clubs, in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper offices
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 24, 1962, pg. A14 reads: "Mapping Plans - Mrs. Ellis Blockson, right, president of the City-County Federation of Negro Women's Clubs, discusses with the Courier's Hazel Garland plans for publicizing the Public Services Institute, which the federation is co-sponsoring with the Carnegie Library and 17 other women's organizations. The institute is slated for March 29, beginning at 10 A.M., at Carnegie Hall in Oakland. - Harris Photo."
